This game, is uttelry fantastic, it really adds tenseness when you are in the middle of nowhere in a forest and you can hear the chainsaw reving up or the sound of a wailing bell. This game does what is basically a friday the 13th game (only now this is very different from the upcoming 2017 Friday the 13th The Game) One person plays as one of 6 current killers, each with a special ability or tool, first is the trapper, he is the default killer that appeard in the beta, he uses a big cleaver as his primary, but can us bear traps to catch the surviviors, then there is the wraith, he uses a syth but has the ability to turn invisible using a wailing bell to catch the survivors off guard, then there is the hillbilly, he has a sledgehammer and a charge chainsaw, then there is the nurse, she has a blink ability to teleport across the map, finally there is Michael Myers(The Shape) and the Hag. Michael Myers can stalk you, the more he stalks, the more his power goes up, giving him the ability to one hit you, at last there is the hag, she is the most recently added killer, she uses traps the spawn a clone of her that she can teleport into at any time or when a survivor trips it, to be honest, the hag is too OP at this moment, so make sure that you look for patches, because this is ridiculous, otherwise, great game.
Changed my review from thumbs down to thumb up, previous bugs have been fixed, new content, much better then Friday the 13th.

yeah, worth maybe 5 bucks, at best

This game is so much fun. 

Word of warning, there are a ton of bugs in the game and the game uses peer to peer connection so the lagginess of the game depends on the killers connection (i.e. if you are in the US, don't play against someone outside the US, etc.).

The grind is intensive and at 300+ hours I almost have one survivor maxed out, that's it. Some I haven't even started on and then on top of that there is the killers to level. At the rate they are releasing DLC, I'll never be able to max them all. If you get this to max out all the characters, killers and survivors, hunker down cause you're in for a long haul. 

The survivors have their own personality per se but they become cookie cutter as each one's unique skills can be learned by the others (same for killers). The devs are trying to push diversity by buffing/nerfing/introducing skills but there are some that you have to have on both sides if you want to "win"

The killers have a strong diversity and each one with their own unigue way of trying to kill you. Herein lies the one major flaw. You have to be alive to aquire points in order to level your survivor if you go that route. This simple point is what divides the community and YOU WILL run into some of the nicest people and downright ugliest human beings in existance. If you get this game, you need to understand that the killer is there to....you guessed it....kill you. The killers get their points to level themselves by a number of means and it all involves stopping you from escaping and ultimately, your death. You cannot come into this game thinking everything is sunshine and rainbows or you will be in for a bad time. It is just like every other game that pits sides against one another; both sides want to win. In this game, that usually comes at a price of the other side not getting their points which leads to the constant (DO NOT GO TO THE DISCUSSIONS/REDDIT/ETC FOR THIS GAME) negative attitudes seen everywhere.

As for the developers, I am somewhere in the middle with them as their communication is very lackluster. I understand they have a mountain of players on both sides that they just have to ignore because of crying of unfairness but in doing so, they lose communication with those that actually have game breaking bugs or the worlds most unstable connection capability to get into a game at all. They do host a stream and try, but it comes off as "troll-y" and the best answers are "we know of this bug and we are working on it". Turn around time is abyssmal on bugs and there are some that are in the game since launch that are still around. They're trying but it doesn't feel like we are getting their all.

TL:DR 
I think the positives out weigh the negatives for now.

Buy this game if you want some scares, some thrilling chases or have a need to conjure your inner killer. DLC comes out steadily and new content is added constantly.

Avoid this game if you are looking for a completed bug-free production, guarenteed lag free games, actual human players, clear lines of communication from the developers, a stable, friendly, decent community or an end game to get to.

Quiero actualizar mi critica a este juego (escribo esto el 5/3/2018) 
El juego es divertido pero tiene muchos fallos, el hecho de que no tenga servidores propios es uno de los principales problemas para todos, pero especialmente para los que jugamos en Latino america, tambien el machmaking es una basura el Lag y asesinos que hacen el juego odioso y aburrido.

PD:El juego no es lo suficientemente bueno para recomendarlo, pero es bastante divertido si tienes un equipo con quien jugarlo

ACTUALIZACION 05-02-2020

Arreglaron muchas cosas, basicamente el lag es casi inexistente, aunque se fueron a la mierda con los DLC, ahora todos los asesinos que salen son de pago, ya no entregan asesinos gratis cada cierto tiempo, como antes. (algunos se pueden comprar con runas, pero son tan caros que basicamente te obligan a pagar por el dlc si quieres al asesino y al superviviente) los asesinos siguen siendo igual de mierdosos ya que si les va mal la partida te face-campean.
Solo puedo decir que es un Juegazoo

Loved this game for a long time, had a lot of fun with it with friends and solo. But lately between the community (Which is the most split I've ever seen in a video game) and the latest updates, aka making absurd killers for people to buy when there are still bugs since release that havent been fixed. I dont enjoy playing this game anymore, the fun has been taken out of it by a terrible community the devs cultivated and horrifically low skill cap killers. Seems like Devs just want an early retirement through DLC's not make a game they are proud of :c  I do need to give the game props for sparking the asymmetrical 4v1 horror movement, just hoping for another one to replace this one.

Really got to play a lot of games to say that its full of toxic people who just hate getting killed or getting bamboozeled by the survivors, its really not that big of a deal but if u like to get trashtalked after every game, this is the game for you.

Its really a game that is really based on your gametime, the more hours you play, the more perks you'll have and more fun at the same time.
The teachable perks are kind of good, and eliminate the factor of you having to buy DLC to get the perks you want,  but you still have to play a lot to get them with your shards.

Overall i would still recommend playing this game if what is mentioned above doesnt make u nauseus.
For me its a perfect game, really fun to chill and after some time you'll get used to it and be able to do kinda well if you put the time and effort in it.
And for all the lockerDwights out there, just get out dude :d

I'm enjoying this game quite a bit. There are bugs, but you come accross them infrequently and they seldomly inhibit your gameplay. The feeling of the two sides is completely polarizing. You have the killer who is a force and and is always driving to get the next kill. On the other hand you have the survivors who are constantly running, juking and dodging the killer while trying to pop generators so they can escape.

Totally worth the price as it provides hours of highs and lows that contribute to the addicting gameplay.

The game has simple concept and straightforward game mechanics. It's easy to play and it doesn't require a lot of knowledge to start playing which makes it one of the top multiplayer horror games.

It can be frustrating at times because it has a competitive ranking system which a lot of people take very seriously but it's best to always move on from any negative games since each match is quite short anyway.

If you're a fan of horror genre and love multiplayer games I would definitely recommend checking out this game! :)

I have been playing this game since the beta, and I've seen the game change and evolve since the beginning.

This is a fun game! I think it is absolutley worth the price of admission, and the constant patching and updating of the game gives you a reason to come back again and again.

I am mostly a survivor player, and I find it thrilling to play a match. It is true that there are sometimes encounters with cheaters and griefers, but my experience has been that they are the minority of cases, and the developers have been doing a good job of addressing and patching the various exploits. I think some people that give the developers grief don't seem to understand how delicate a balance this kind of game is, and how quickly they are actually pushing out fixes along with new content! It's actually amazing how responsive they are to constantly and consistently improving this game.

There is no better feeling than having a really close match and just barely surviving, or no worse feeling than nearly surviving and being outplayed at the last moment by the killer. It is these experiences that always pull me back to playing this game. When it starts to feel stale, I just take a break for a month or so, wait for a new patch of DLC chapter, and jump back in, and have a blast!

nice game

There you are, crouched down, slowly repairing a generator to make it functional again. You're aware of your surroundings and are on constant alert for the killer. Then in the silence, a faint heartbeat is heard...you know the killer is close. As the heartbeat gets louder you decide it's better to survive than be caught, so you slowly creep away to hide behind a boulder. But it was too late, the killer spotted your crouched silhouette and starts lumbering right towards you. You sprint away, not worrying about the trail you leave behind, all that matters now... is escape. You run, looking for any path that could throw him off your trail. The heartbeat is now accompanied by a anxiety inducing grinding noise...you know he's closer. You dodge around trees and hay bales, hoping he slips up. The music and heartbeat more intense than ever and now a red glow shines on your back. You know he is right behind you know. Your blood flushes from your head, and just as the killer swings their weapon, you slam a pallet down between the two of you, stunning the killer. As you hear his moans of frustration at his ruined kill, you hop through an open window and slowly crawl out into cover. You crouch in hiding, as you watch him search the area for you. He eventually give up chase and goes off to find another survivor. You crawl away, looking for the next generator to repair and hopefully make way for your escape. 



If you've ever played Amnesia, then you know about the water filled hallway sequence. Dead by Daylight is that...but for the whole time...and it's awesome!
This is honestly one of the best games I've played in a long time.  Are there balance tweeks to be made? Yes..But every game like this has tweeks to be made. It's a constant balance that doesn't ever really end, and I think the devs are doing a great job at it. The feeling of escape or the feeling of a perfect kill is great. Being the last survivor and finally escaping through the hatch after a long cat and mouse game is also one of the big highlights of this game. 
Dont let the naysayers with "OP!" and "It's BROKEN!" and "UNFAIR!" throw you off... Don't get bitter, get better and get this game! Oh...and stay away from the dungeons...bad juju down there.

Jedenfalls ist es super geworden das Game. Einige Bugs m√ºssten noch behoben werden.
Was mir fehlt sind mehrere Modis. z.B. 8 Survivor und 2 Killer und 8 Gens zu machen auf gr√∂√üeren Maps. Oder 4 √úberlebende bestehend aus 2er Teams die gegeneinander Spielen und halt der Killer. Die Teams wollen das andere Team ausschalten durch Sandbagging um zu Gewinnen, oder halt wer am Ende die meisten Punkte hat, wenn alle tot sind, gewinnt. Ist ein komplettes Team am Boden oder am Haken, so muss das Gegnerteam einer Person helfen.
Nun w√§re zumindest mal eine Idee f√ºr Modis die realistisch w√§ren ^^

¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Dead by Daylight √© um jogo online/coop onde voc√™ pode jogar de sobrevivente ou assassino, o objetivo de sobrevivente √© ligar geradores e fugir do assassino, o objetivo do assassino √© impedir que os sobreviventes fujam, no come√ßo parece que n√£o vai render muitas horas de jogatina, pois o game aparentemente tem pouco conte√∫do e voc√™ imagina que vai enjoar com 10 horas de jogo, mas n√£o √© assim, √© praticamente um RPG, quanto mais voc√™ joga mais voc√™ quer jogar pra melhorar, upar e ser o melhor.
